articles.description: Earth is, in many ways, a water world. Around two-thirds of its surface is covered in water, and the oceans that provide that cover make up over 96% of all water on Earth, according to the US Geological Survey. Glaciers and ice caps make up another 1.74%, but…

articles.title: Researcher spies invisible aurora in NASA satellite data - KJZZ
articles.description: Auroras appear to human eyes as ethereal curtains of visible light.But, as a new paper in the journal Geophysical Research Letters explains, there are also scores of auroras visible only to electronic eyes.“They all have different reasons for occurring,” said…
